cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the northern Caribbean and Bahamas toward south Florida

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Florida at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Florida at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coast (including Palm Beach County), Bahamas, north coast of Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, northern Cuba
weather_observation.wind: 80% chance of tropical-storm-force winds and 36% chance of hurricane-force winds at the port; peak winds could exceed 64 kt if the core tracks close to southeast Florida.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge of 3–6 ft possible along the southeast Florida coast including Palm Beach County if Irma approaches from the south.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts likely, producing urban and coastal flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and coastal erosion that will hamper vessel operations and terminal access.
